title: Google-Facebook Ad Deal Is Investigated by EU, U.K.
sub_head: Antitrust authorities open probes into a once-secret 2018 deal known as Jedi Blue
body:
The European Union and the U.K. are ramping up their parallel crackdowns on big tech companies, opening formal antitrust investigations into whether Alphabet Inc.’s Google and Facebook owner Meta Platforms Inc. sought to illegally fix prices in digital advertising.
The European Commission, the EU’s top antitrust enforcer, and the U.K.’s Competition and Markets Authority said Friday they are each investigating a once-secret 2018 deal, known as Jedi Blue, that emerged as part of a lawsuit brought a year and a half ago by a group of U.S. states led by Texas.
